member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert
member.summary: Represents an alert, which generates periodic e-mail notifications sent to a user about the list, list item, document, or document library to which the alert applies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.Update(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the Microsoft SharePoint database with changes made to the alert and sends a confirmation e-mail message if a parameter contains true.
member.param: true to send confirmation e-mail; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the time interval for sending the alert.
member.returns: An value that specifies the time interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the alert template of which the alert is an instance.
member.returns: An object that represents the alert template. This property contains null if the alert is a custom alert without a defined template.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time for sending the alert.
member.returns: A System.DateTime structure that specifies the date and time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlertType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of object to which the alert applies, which can be a list or document library, a list item or document, or a custom object.
member.returns: An value that specifies the type of item to which the alert applies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.AlwaysNotify
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that causes the alert to always trigger, even if there is no matching event.
member.returns: true to cause the alert to always trigger; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.DynamicRecipient
member.summary: Gets or sets the string in Collaborative Application Markup Language (CAML) that defines the event data to use to populate the e-mail recipient field in the alert.
member.returns: A CAML string that contains the event data for the e-mail recipient field, for example, <FieldRef Name = "assignedto/New">, where /New is optional.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPAlert.EventType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of event to which the alert applies.
member.returns: An value that specifies the types of events applicable to a list, document library, list item, or document.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of event to which the alert applies as a bitmask.
member.returns: An integer that specifies the bitmask.

member.summary: Gets or sets the syntax query in Collaborative Application Markup Language (CAML) for a filter to apply to the alert.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange
member.summary: Represents a change that has been made to objects or metadata within an item, list, Web site, or site collection scope, or a security policy change at the Web application scope that has been recorded in the Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services change log.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.ChangeToken
member.summary: Gets the unique change token of the object that has changed.
member.returns: An object that represents the change token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.ChangeType
member.summary: Gets the type of change that has been made to the item.
member.returns: An value that indicates the type of change, including adding, updating, deleting, or renaming changes, but also moving items away from or into lists and folders. The value Rename applies to a change in the object’s URL at the leaf node. The values MovedAway and MovedInto apply to a change in one of the branch nodes of the URL. In order to correctly record moves, the change log records the following:Moving from or to a folder:MovedAway event on the source list.MovedInto event on the destination list.Moving from or to a site:MovedAway event on the source Web site.MovedInto event on the destination site.At the and scopes, only the MovedAway event is recorded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.SiteId
member.summary: Gets the site ID of the site collection in which the object changed.
member.returns: A GUID that represents the site ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChange.Time
member.summary: Gets the time at which the change was committed to the change log.
member.returns: A DateTime structure that indicates when the change was committed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeAlert
member.summary: Represents a change to an alert.

member.summary: Gets the GUID that identifies the alert that changed.
member.returns: A GUID that identifies the alert.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeAlert.WebId
member.summary: Gets the GUID of the site in which the alert changed.
member.returns: A GUID that identifies the site.

member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of changes.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection includes all changes that have occurred after the creation of the content database.
member.returns: true if the collection includes all changes since creation of the content database; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeQuery
member.summary: Defines a query that is performed against the change log in Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeQuery.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: true to return all object types in the change query; otherwise, false. If false, no changes are returned unless at least one of the object type properties is set to true. Setting this parameter to true overrides any object type property settings. This parameter works together with the AllChangeTypes parameter.

true to return all types of changes in the query; otherwise, false. If false, no changes are returned unless at least one of the change type properties is set to true. Setting this parameter to true overrides any change type property settings. This parameter works together with the AllChangeObjectTypes parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeQuery.Add
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether add changes are included in the query.
member.returns: true if add changes are returned; otherwise, false.

member.returns: true if changes to alerts are returned; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeToken
member.summary: Represents the unique sequential location of a change within the change log.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeToken.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on its serialized form.
member.param: A string that contains the serialized form of the change token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeToken.#ctor(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeCollection.CollectionScope,System.Guid,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified change collection scope, corresponding object ID, and a DateTime structure that indicates the beginning change time for the change token.
member.param: A GUID that specifies the object ID.
A System.DateTime structure that specifies the beginning change time to include in the change token.
An value that specifies the scope of the change token, which can be a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeToken.ToString
member.summary: Returns the serialized string representation of the change token.
member.returns: A string that contains the serialized representation of the change token, with parts in the following order, each section separated by a semicolon:Version number.Number that represents one of the values:0--content database1--site collection2--site3--listGUID that represents the scope ID of the change token.Time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format when the change occurred.Number of the change relative to other changes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeToken.Scope
member.summary: Gets the scope of the changes contained in a collection of changes, which can be a list, site, site collection, or content database.
member.returns: A value that indicates the scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeToken.ScopeId
member.summary: Gets the GUID of the object providing the scope for the collection containing the parent change object.
member.returns: A GUID that identifies the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType
member.summary: Specifies the type of change to return through a query against the change log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Add
member.summary: An item is added within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.AssignmentAdd
member.summary: A user is given permissions to a list with unique permissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.AssignmentDelete
member.summary: Permissions are removed for a user in a list with unique permissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Delete
member.summary: An item is deleted within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MemberAdd
member.summary: A user is added to a group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MemberDelete
member.summary: A user is removed from a group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MoveAway
member.summary: Involves the renaming of a non-leaf section within a URL. The item was moved away from the location within the Web site specified by the change. The log will contain either a MoveAway or a MoveInto value for any given change, but not both. If possible, the change is represented as MoveInto.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.MoveInto
member.summary: Involves the renaming of a non-leaf section within a URL. The item was moved into the location within the Web site specified by the change. The log will contain either a MoveAway or a MoveInto value for any given change, but not both. If possible, the change is represented as MoveInto.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Navigation
member.summary: A change in navigation is made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Rename
member.summary: The leaf in a URL is renamed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Restore
member.summary: An object is restored from a backup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.RoleAdd
member.summary: A role definition is added.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.RoleDelete
member.summary: A role definition is deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.RoleUpdate
member.summary: A role definition is updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.SystemUpdate
member.summary: Changes are made that are global within the scope of the change collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPChangeType.Update
member.summary: An item is modified within the scope of a list, site, site collection, or content database.

member.returns: An object that represents the Windows SharePoint Services context.
member.param: A System.Type that represents the type of item.
A System.Web.HTTPContext object that encapsulates the HTTP-specific context that is used by the server to process site requests.
A 32-bit integer that identifies the item.

A System.Web.HTTPContext object that encapsulates the HTTP-specific context that is used by the server to process site requests.

A System.Guid that identifies the view.
A System.Web.HTTPContext object that encapsulates the HTTP-specific context that is used by the server to process site requests.
A System.Guid that identifies the list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPContext.GetContext(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Int32,System.Guid,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb)
member.summary: Returns the Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services context for an item that is not list-based using the specified HTTP context, item ID, list ID, and Web site.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings
member.summary: Represents the data retrieval service settings that are used in a virtual server running Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services.

member.summary: Gets an integer that indicates the maximum size in kilobytes for responses returned from the data retrieval service adapter used in the deployment of Windows SharePoint Services.
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of kilobytes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Gets an integer value that indicates the number of seconds that transpire before requests made to the data source time out.
member.returns: A 32-bit integer that indicates the number of seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.ServicesEnabled
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether data retrieval services are enabled in the deployment of Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services.
member.returns: true if data retrieval services are enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDataRetrievalServicesSettings.UpdateAllowed
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether a data retrieval service adapter can run queries that update back-end data.
member.returns: true if all data retrieval service adapters can be updated; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets the URL of the document that has been discussed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary
member.summary: Represents a document library in Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.GetItemsInFolder(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPView,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFolder)
member.summary: Returns a collection of items from the document library based on the specified view and folder.
member.returns: An object that represents the documents.
member.param: An object representing the view through which to retrieve items from the document library.
An object representing the folder from which to retrieve items. If null, returns items in the root folder of the list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.CheckedOutFiles
member.summary: Gets the collection of files that are checked out of the document library.
member.returns: A System.Collections.Generic.IList collection of objects representing the checked out files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.DocumentTemplateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the document template for the library relative to the Web site that contains the document library.
member.returns: A string that contains the URL, for example, Shared Documents/Forms/template.doc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.EmailInsertsFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the path for the public folder that contains the e-mail items inserted in the document library.
member.returns: A string that contains the path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.IsCatalog
member.summary: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the document library is a gallery, such as for site templates, list templates, Web Parts, or Master Pages.
member.returns: true if the document library library is a gallery; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.Items
member.summary: Returns all the files within the document library, including those in any subfolders.
member.returns: A object that represents all the files in the document library.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPDocumentLibrary.ServerRelativeDocumentTemplateUrl
member.summary: Gets the server-relative URL of the document template for the library.
member.returns: A string that contains the URL. If the absolute URL to the document template is http://MyServer//MyWebSite/Shared Documents/Forms/template.doc, this property returns /MyWebSite/Shared Documents/Forms/template.doc.

member.summary: Specifies the URI that is provisioned by Windows SharePoint Services.

A string containing the date the item was last modified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFile.Convert(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Transforms the file using the specified transformer.
member.returns: A value that indicates the conversion status.
member.param: A string containing configuration information that is passed to the transform application when thistransform is requested. The information should be specific to the transformapplication and can be an empty string or null.
A System.Guid that identifies the specific document transformer to use to transform the document.
An out parameter that gets the ID of thework item for this asynchronous request, or that gets Guid.Empty in the synchronous case.

The priority of this transform. A lowerpriority means this transform will be processed faster. Transformsinitiated through the user interface have a priority of 1. Bulk operationsperformed through custom script should have a lower priority.
true to run the conversion synchronously; otherwise, false.
A string containing the leaf name of the file to be created. The extension is automatically appended by the transformer.
true to attach a copy of the transformed document to the notification; otherwise, false.
A semi-colon-delimited list of email addresses of people to whom to send an alert when the transform is completed. If the string is empty or null, no alert is sent.

member.summary: Copies the file to the destination URL but overwrites an existing file of the same name only if bOverwrite is true.
member.param: A string that specifies the destination URL.
true to overwrite a file of the same name; otherwise false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPIssueList
member.summary: Represents an issues list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPIssueList.CreateIssueReport(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.SharePoint.SPIssueList.ReportType,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Creates a report for an Issues list.
member.returns: true if the report is successfully created; otherwise, false.
member.param: A value that specifies the kind of report to return. The following table shows which of the other parameters to specify for this method based on the type of report that is specified.TypeParametersByCategoryCategory, StatusByOwnerAssignedToUserID, StatusCreationTimelineCategory, CreatedByUserID, StartDate, EndDateStatusTimelineCategory, AssignedToUserID, StartDate, EndDate, Status
An unsigned 32-bit integer that specifies the ID of the user to whom the issue is assigned. Set to -1 to create a report on issues assigned to all users.
A string that specifies the start date for the issue according to the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) in the format yyyymmddThhmmssZ.
A string that specifies a category for the issue. Set to null to return all categories in the report.
A string that specifies the end date for the issue according to the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) in the format yyyymmddThhmmssZ.
An object that returns the data in the report.
A string that specifies the status for the issue. Set to null to create a report that includes all statuses for an issue.
An unsigned 32-bit integer that specifies the ID of the user who created the issue. Set to -1 to create a report on issues created by all users.
An unsigned 32-bit integer that returns the number of columns used in the report.
An unsigned 32-bit integer that returns the number of rows used in the report.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup
member.summary: Represents the permissions available for role definitions on a Web site. This enumeration is obsolete. Instead use the enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Administrator
member.summary: Has full control of the Web site, including the ability to manage role definitions and groups and to view usage data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.All
member.summary: Has all permissions on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader permissions, as well as permissions to add and edit items, manage personal groups and views, and personalize Web Parts Pages. Cannot create lists or document libraries, but can add content to existing ones.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Guest
member.summary: Has limited permissions to view specific pages and page elements. Has access to a specific list but not to the entire site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.None
member.summary: Has no permissions on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.Reader
member.summary: Has read-only access to the Web site and cannot add content. Has permissions to view items, personalize Web Parts, use alerts, and create a Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.ValidPermissions
member.summary: Has valid permissions for the site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Contributor permissions, plus permissions to cancel check-out, delete items, manage lists, and add and customize pages. Can modify the structure of the site and create lists or document libraries.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64
member.summary: Represents the permissions available for role definitions on a Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Administrator
member.summary: Has full control of the Web site, including the ability to manage site groups and cross-site groups and to view usage data. Includes the FullMask base permission (see ). Value = 9223372036854775807

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.All
member.summary: Has all permissions on the Web site. Includes the base permissions of Administrator. Value = 9223372036854775807

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader permissions, as well as permissions to add and edit items, manage personal groups and views, and personalize Web Parts Pages. Cannot create lists or document libraries, but can add content to existing ones. In addition to the base permissions of Reader, includes the following base permissions (see ): BrowseDirectories, ManagePersonalViews, UpdatePersonalWebParts, AddDelPrivateWebParts, AddListItems, EditListItems, DeleteListItems, DeleteVersions, EditMyUserInfo. Value = 1856436900591

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Guest
member.summary: Has limited permissions to view specific pages and page elements. Has access to a specific list but not to the entire site. Includes the following base permissions (see ): Open, BrowseUserInfo, ViewFormPages, UseClientIntegration, UseRemoteAPIs. Value = 206292717568

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.None
member.summary: Has no permissions on the Web site. Value = 0

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.Reader
member.summary: Has read-only access to the Web site and cannot add content. Has permissions to view items, personalize Web Parts, use alerts, and create a Web site. In addition to the base permissions of Guest, includes the following base permissions (see ): ViewPages, ViewListItems, OpenItems, ViewVersions, CreateAlerts, CreateSSCSite. Value = 756052856929

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.ValidPermissions
member.summary: Has valid permissions for the site. Includes the following base permissions (see ): ViewListItems, ViewFormPages,AddListItems, EditListItems, DeleteListItems, ApproveItems, CancelCheckout, ManagePersonalViews, ManageLists, Open, ViewPages, AddAndCustomizePages, ApplyThemeAndBorder, ApplyStyleSheets, ViewUsageData, CreateSSCSite, ManageSubwebs, CreateGroups, ManagePermissions, BrowseDirectories, BrowseUserInfo, AddDelPrivateWebParts, UpdatePersonalWebParts, ManageWeb, UseRemoteAPIs, EditMyUserInfo, EnumeratePermissions, OpenItems, ViewVersions, DeleteVersions, ManageAlerts, CreateAlerts. Value = 4611688082159115263

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPPermissionGroup64.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Contributor permissions, plus permissions to cancel check-out, delete items, manage lists, and add and customize pages. Can modify the structure of the site and create lists or document libraries. member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.AddAndCustomizePages
member.summary: Value: 0x00040000. Add, change, or delete ASPX pages, HTML pages, or Web Part Pages, and edit the Web site using a Windows SharePoint Services-compatible editor. Groups: Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.AddDelPrivateWebParts
member.summary: Value: 0x10000000. Add or remove Web Parts on a personalized Web Part Page. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.AddListItems
member.summary: Value: 0x00000002. Add items to lists, add documents to document libraries, and add Web discussion comments. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ApplyStyleSheets
member.summary: Value: 0x00100000. Apply a style sheet (.CSS file) to the Web site. Groups: Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ApplyThemeAndBorder
member.summary: Value: 0x00080000. Apply a theme or borders to the entire Web site. Groups: Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.BrowseDirectories
member.summary: Value: 0x04000000. Browse directories in a Web site. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.BrowseUserInfo
member.summary: Value: 0x08000000. View information about users. This right is not available through the user interface. Guest, Reader, Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.CancelCheckout
member.summary: Value: 0x00000100. Check in a document without saving the current changes. Groups: Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.CreatePersonalGroups
member.summary: Value: 0x01000000. Create, change, and delete site groups, including adding users to the site groups and specifying which rights are assigned to a site group. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.CreateSSCSite
member.summary: Value: 0x00400000. Create a Web site using Self-Service Site Creation. Groups: Reader, Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.DeleteListItems
member.summary: Value: 0x00000008. Delete items from a list, documents from a document library, and Web discussion comments in documents. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.EditListItems
member.summary: Value: 0x00000004. Edit items in lists, edit documents in document libraries, edit Web discussion comments in documents, and customize Web Part Pages in document libraries. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.EmptyMask
member.summary: Value: 0x00000000. Has no permissions on the Web site. Not available through the user interface. Groups: N/A.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.FullMask
member.summary: Value: -1. Has all permissions on the Web site. Not available through the user interface. Groups: N/A.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ManageListPermissions
member.summary: Value: 0x00000400. Grant, deny, or change user permissions to a list. Groups: Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ManageLists
member.summary: Value: 0x00000800. Approve content in lists, add or remove columns in a list, and add or remove public views of a list. Groups: Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ManagePersonalViews
member.summary: Value: 0x00000200. Create, change, and delete personal views of lists. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ManageRoles
member.summary: Value: 0x02000000. Create, change, and delete site groups, including adding users to the site groups and specifying which rights are assigned to a site group. Groups: Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ManageSubwebs
member.summary: Value: 0x00800000. Manage or create subsites. Groups: Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ManageWeb
member.summary: Value: 0x40000000. Manage a site, including the ability to perform all administration tasks for the site and manage contents and permissions. Groups: Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.OpenWeb
member.summary: Value: 0x00010000. Open the SharePoint Web site and get metadata related to the site, as well as see the underlying navigation structure (not exposed in the user interface). Groups: Guest, Reader, Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.UpdatePersonalWebParts
member.summary: Value: 0x20000000. Update Web Parts to display personalized information. Groups: Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ViewListItems
member.summary: Value: 0x00000001. View items in lists, documents in document libraries, view Web discussion comments, and set up e-mail alerts for lists. Groups: Reader, Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ViewPages
member.summary: Value: 0x00020000. View pages in a Web site. Groups: Reader, Contributor, Web Designer, Administrator.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRights.ViewUsageData
member.summary: Value: 0x00200000. View reports on Web site usage. Groups: Administrator.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType
member.summary: Specifies the type of site groups available for users and groups.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Administrator
member.summary: Has all rights from other site groups, plus rights to manage site groups and view usage analysis data. The Administrator site group cannot be customized or deleted, and there must always be at least one member of the Administrator site group. Members of the Administrator site group always have access to, or can grant themselves access to, any item in the Web site. All rights included in the WebDesigner site group, plus the following: ManageListPermissions, ManageRoles, ManageSubwebs, ViewUsageData.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Contributor
member.summary: Has Reader rights, plus rights to add, edit, and delete items, manage list permissions, manage personal views, personalize Web Part Pages, and browse directories. Contributors cannot create new lists or document libraries, but they can add content to existing lists and document libraries. All rights included in the Reader site group, plus the following: AddDelPrivateWebParts, AddListItems, BrowseDirectories, CreatePersonalGroups, DeleteListItems, EditListItems, ManagePersonalViews, UpdatePersonalWebParts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Guest
member.summary: Has limited rights to view pages and specific page elements. This site group is used for giving users access to a particular page, list, or item in a list, without granting them rights to view the entire site. Users cannot be explicitly added to the Guest site group, rather users who are given access to lists or document libraries by way of per-list permissions are automatically added to the Guest site group. The Guest site group cannot be customized or deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.None
member.summary: Has no rights on the Web site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.Reader
member.summary: Has rights to view items, personalize Web parts, use alerts, and create their own top-level Web site using Self-Service Site Creation. Readers can only read a site; they cannot add content. Note that when a reader creates a site using Self-Service Site Creation, he or she becomes the site owner and a member of the Administrator site group for the new site. This does not affect the users site group membership for any other site. Rights included: CreateSSCSite, ViewListItems, ViewPages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleType.WebDesigner
member.summary: Has Contributor rights, plus rights to cancel checkout, delete items, manage lists, add and customize pages, define and apply themes and borders, and link style sheets. Web Designers can modify the structure of the site and create new lists or document libraries. All rights included in the Contributor site group, plus the following: AddAndCustomizePages, ApplyStyleSheets, ApplyThemeAndBorder, CancelCheckout, ManageLists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb.GetSiteData(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSiteDataQuery)
member.summary: Performs a query for list items across multiple lists, which may be located in multiple web sites in the same web site collection.
member.returns: A System.Data.DataTable object that represents the result of the query. Each DataRow object in the DataTable.Rows collection represents a single item satisfying the query. Each DataColumn object in the DataTable.Columns collection represents a field requested in the query fields, and the column name of the field equals that specified through the Name attribute for that field. In addition, DataTable.Columns contains a DataColumn named ListId, which identifies the list that contains each item, and one named WebId, which identifies the Web site that contains each item.
member.param: An object that describes the query to perform, as well as specifying which Web sites and lists participate, which fields to return, and the and sections to apply.

member.returns: A object that represents the collection of subsites.
member.param: A 16-bit integer that specifies the ID of a configuration. This parameter corresponds to the ID attribute of the Configuration element in CAML.
A 32-bit integer that specifies the site definition. This parameter corresponds to the ID attribute of the Template element in Collaborative Application Markup Language (CAML).

A value that specifies the type of report to be created.

For example, Team Site - %LCID%1033 - %GTID%_GLOBAL_#1 - %TMPLID%STS#0 A site for teams to quickly organize, author, and share information. It provides a document library, and lists for managing announcements, calendar items, tasks, and discussions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPGlobalAdmin.AddWPPack(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Either enables a Web Part Package that is already installed on the virtual server and adds it to the Web Part gallery, or installs and enables a Web Part Package and adds it to the Web Part gallery.
member.param: A string that contains the URL for the virtual server. The strURL parameter is used in conjunction with the strName or strPathname parameter. If strURL is set to null, the Web Part Package specified by the strName parameter is enabled for all virtual servers on the front-end Web server, or the Web Part Package specified by the strPathname parameter is installed on all virtual servers on the front-end Web server.
true to install the Web Part Package to each front-end Web server in a server farm; otherwise, false.

A string that contains the file name of the installed Web Part Package to enable. If not specified, then strPathname must be specified. The strName parameter is used in conjunction with the strURL parameter. If strURL contains null, the Web Part Package is enabled for all virtual servers on the front-end Web server; otherwise, the package is enabled for the virtual server specified by strURL.
true to overwrite an existing Web Part Package with a new version; otherwise, false.

A string that contains the full file system path for the Web Part Package to install. If not specified, then strName must be specified. The strPathname parameter is used in conjunction with the strURL parameter. If strURL contains null, the Web Part Package is installed on all virtual servers on the front-end Web server; otherwise, the package is installed on the virtual server specified by strURL.
A System.IO.TextWriter object that is used to write an error log to the text stream. This parameter can contain null.
An unsigned 32-bit integer that specifies the locale ID for the Web Part Package. This parameter can be 0 or any valid LCID (1033 for English).

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPrefixType.Exclusion
member.summary: This enumeration member is obsolete in Windows SharePoint Services (version 3) as it is no longer necessary to tell WSS which URL paths should not be handled by WSS. When the IIS worker process serving this web application is started, it scans the IIS home directory of this web application looking for files, folders, and virtual directories. Those that it finds are automatically excluded, and are not listed in the .This member generates a compiler warning—no operation is performed and no exception is thrown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPPrefixType.WildcardInclusion
member.summary: Multiple path-based site collections can be created below this URL path.

member.summary: Reserved for internal use only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPSolution.Deploy(System.DateTime,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a timer job to deploy the language-neutral solution or Web Part package at a specified time.
member.param: If true, then a solution can be redeployed; if false, and the solution has already been deployed, an exception is raised.
A DateTime object containing the time to run the timer job.
Used only in the deployment of web part packages. If true, then strong-named assemblies are installed in the GAC; if false, they are installed to the bin directory of the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPSolution.Deploy(System.DateTime,System.Boolean,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebApplication},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a timer job to deploy the language-neutral solution or Web Part package to the specified web applications at a specified time.
member.param: If true, then a solution can be redeployed; if false, and the solution has already been deployed, an exception is raised.
A collection of objects to deploy to when there are application-specific entities in the solution or Web Part package.
A DateTime object containing the time to run the timer job.
Used only in the deployment of web part packages. If true, then strong-named assemblies are installed in the GAC; if false, they are installed to the bin directory of the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Utilities.SPUtility.AlternateServerUrlFromHttpRequestUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Returns the outgoing URL for the alternate request URL represented by the specified URI.
member.returns: A System.Uri object that represents the outgoing URL and any additional parts of the URL, such as the path, that together compose the complete incoming URL. For example, if the incoming URL is http://incoming and the outgoing URL is http://outgoing, this method returns http://outgoing. If the incoming URL is http://incoming/sites/mySite/Lists/myList/AllItems.aspx, the returned URI object would represent http://outgoing/sites/mySite/Lists/myList/AllItems.aspx. If no outgoing URL is defined for the zone associated with the incoming URL, or that incoming URL is not included within a collection of alternate URLs, Windows SharePoint Services returns the same System.Uri that was passed as parameter to this method.
member.param: A System.Uri object that represents the request URL.

member.summary: ID for the list item which this form is currently rendering. This is by default set to according to the ID in the URL browsed to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls.FormComponent.List
member.summary: List for which this form is for. This is set in the thread context for the page browse so that all controls on the page will have access to the SPList by the first control which references this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls.FormComponent.ListId
member.summary: List of the list which this form is for. This is here to give developers the ability programmatically override the ListName property to set their own list despite the list in the URL. By default this is set according to the URL browsed to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebControls.FormComponent.ListItem
member.summary: Based on the ListItemID. The first control to reference the SPListItem will both query for the Object and store the SPListItem object in the thread context to allow all controls to use the ListItem without multiple trips to the database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.HtmlDesignerAttribute.DialogFeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape, size, or other features of the custom properties builder dialog box.
member.returns: String Specifies the properties for the custom properties builder dialog box.The following list details the allowable values for the DialogFeatures property:OptionValuesDescriptiondialogHeightsHeightSets the height of the dialog box.dialogLeftsXPosSets the left position of the dialog box relative to the upper-left corner of the desktop.dialogTopsYPosSets the top position of the dialog box relative to the upper-left corner of the desktop.dialogWidthsWidthSets the width of the dialog box.centeryes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether to center the dialog box within the desktop. The default is Yes. dialogHideyes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether the dialog box is hidden when printing or using print preview. This feature is only available when a dialog box is opened from a trusted application. The default is No.edgesunken, raisedSpecifies the edge style of the dialog box. The default is Raised.helpyes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether the dialog box displays the context-sensitive Help icon. The default is Yes. resizableyes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether the dialog box has fixed dimensions. The default is No. scrollyes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether the dialog box displays scrollbars. The default is Yes. statusyes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether the dialog box displays a status bar. The default is Yes for untrusted dialog boxes and No for trusted dialog boxes. unadornedyes, no, 1, 0, on, offSpecifies whether the dialog box displays the window border. This feature is only available when a dialog box is opened from a trusted application. The default is No.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.HtmlDesignerAttribute.HtmlEditorBuilderType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of custom HTML property builder.
member.returns: String Specifies the type of builder. Use the to support builders of these types: color, date, file, font, picture, and string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPart.GetToolParts
member.summary: Determines which tool parts are displayed in the tool pane of the Web-based Web Part design user interface, and the order in which they are displayed.
member.returns: An array of type that determines which tool parts will be displayed in the tool pane. If a Web Part that implements one or more custom properties does not override the method, the base class method will return an instance of the class and an instance of the class. An instance of the class displays a tool part for working with the properties provided by the WebPart base class. An instance of the class displays a built-in tool part for working custom Web Part properties, as long as the custom property is of one of the types supported by that tool part. The supported types are: String, Boolean, Integer, DateTime, or Enum.

member.summary: Registers an interface from the namespace for a connectable Web Part.

The label that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.

A valuethat specifies where the interface can be run.
The string used to reference the interface in script for client-side connections, for example RowProviderInterface_WPQ_.
The specified limit on the number of connections to this interface. Can be either or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPart.RegisterInterface(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.ConnectionRunAt,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers an interface from the namespace for a connectable Web Part with the option of specifying how cross-page connections are handled.
member.param: A brief description of the interface that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.
The label that will be used in the user interface for creating a Web Part connection with this interface.

Specifies whether this connection interface is exposed in the user interface of authoring environments for creating a connection across two Web Part pages. If the value is set to true, this connection interface is exposed in the authoring environment for creating cross-page connections within the limitations of the connection compatibility rules defined by the Web Part infrastructure. If the value is set to false, the interface is not available for authoring cross-page connections.
A valuethat specifies where the interface can be run.
The string used to reference the interface in script for client-side connections, for example RowProviderInterface_WPQ_.
The type of the interface as listed in the fields of the class.
The specified limit on the number of connections to this interface. Can be either or .
A reference to the implemented interface.
The friendly name of the interface.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPartZone
member.summary: Allows you to create zones that are containers for Web Parts. The properties of this class allow you to specify how the zone will appear on your Web Part Page and also the behavior of the zone itself. For example, when you create the zone object, you can allow personalization and/or customization for the Web Parts placed within the zone.

member.name: N:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication
member.summary: Provides a set of interfaces and their supporting classes and members that can be implemented in the class of a custom Web Part to support creating connections with other Web Parts. A Web Part can implement one or more of these interfaces to allow it to receive or pass information to other connected Web Parts on a Web Part Page. A Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication namespace interface is a set of events and event handlers for providing or consuming data from list, row, and cell data contained within a Web Part.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.IParametersInConsumer.ParametersInReady(System.Object,Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.ParametersInReadyEventArgs)
member.summary: Provides an event handler for the event of a provider Web Part that implements the interface.
member.param: A Web Part that implements the IParametersInProvider interface.

A ParametersInReadyEventArgs that provides an array of string parameter values through its ParameterValues property. The number and order of parameters contained in this array must match those specified by the ParametersInConsumerInitEventArgs argument of the ParametersInConsumerInit method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.IParametersInProvider
member.summary: Allows a provider Web Part to communicate its parameter list to other consumer Web Parts.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.IParametersInProvider.NoParametersIn
member.summary: Occurs when there is no parameter list available to be sent to the consumer Web Part.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.IParametersInProvider.ParametersInReady
member.summary: Occurs when the parameter list is ready to be sent to the consumer Web Part. On the client computer, it can occur at any time; however, it is typically raised when a parameter is updated or selected. On the server, it must be raised in the PartCommunicationMain method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.IParametersInProvider.ParametersInConsumerInit(System.Object,Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.ParametersInConsumerInitEventArgs)
member.summary: Provides an event handler for a provider Web Part to process the event of a consumer Web Part that implements the interface.
member.param: A Web Part that implements the IParametersInConsumer interface.
A ParametersInConsumerInitEventArgs that provides an array of objects. Each item in the array contains property values for a parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.Communication.IParametersOutConsumer
